intro: Arnebia cana, commonly known as the pink root or red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pinkish-red flowers. Arnebia cana thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
